Text2: 1350 SF Cabin-Like Apartment 10 Min. from NW Trains - Change Your View
Text3:
QR Code Link to This Post
            
        
This is a beautiful one-bedroom with den / 2nd bedroom, second-floor, 1350 square foot apartment on the second level of a water’s-edge 30’ X 40’ barn - an open space, unique, rustic, tranquil, private, country loft tucked-in off a country road on a small lake. Very private and rustic - Yet you are just 10 minutes from the NW Train Lines and all the conveniences of Crystal Lake and the excellent Prairie Grove school system.

This open-floor-plan loft apartment occupies the entire second level of a renovated horse barn.  Plus, there is a dedicated 150 square foot laundry and storage room on the first level with storage,  a utility sink, washer and dryer. The apartment has historically housed one or two individuals, has cathedral ceilings, plenty of large windows and is tucked-in next to woods and a small lake. The walls and cathedral ceilings are knotty pine; the floors are beautiful oak hardwood.  This like-new apartment has a full kitchen, full bath, natural gas forced-air heat, four large attractive ceiling fans, dishwasher hookups, two sets of large French doors and central AC. 

The barn and apartment are part of a family compound that sits on 3.3 acres with a small lake and is surrounded by 1,000 + acres of forever wild and farm land. This property is very secluded and private in all directions.   All this living space and privacy is just 10 minutes from the Northwestern Train line and downtown Crystal Lake and from Prairie Grove’s excellent schools.  $1500 / month plus gas and electric utilities. No Pets. No Smoking.  Available November 16.  One and one-half month rent security deposit plus first month’s rent.

There are washer & dryer connections inside the house. All existing appliances convey. This would make a great first home or rental property. Chain-link fenced backyard. Text2: Large LAKE HOUSE With POOL
Text3:
QR Code Link to This Post
            
        
Large lake home with above ground pool for rent in Havana IL. Backyard is completely private in the summer and has amazing lake views and sunsets over the lake from backyard, living areas and master bedroom. Home is about 45 mins from Peoria and 45 mins from Springfield in safe small town and ideally located on dead end street. We are having two bedrooms enclosed downstairs so will be four bedroom, two bath.  Has private sand beach on the lake. Has multiple large living areas and large dining room. New slate fridge and range.  Oversized detached two car garage. Basketball court in front yard.   Home is ideal for bird enthusiaists as it is located between two national wildlife refuges and is on direct migratory path for many species as well as home to eagles.  Applicants must pass background check, credit check, income verification and landlord reference.  Absoloutly no pets and no air bnbs. Application is $50 per person over 18 with Landlord Tenant Services. Must be able to maintain above ground pool in summer.

Text2: Great 2 BR Apt
Text3:
QR Code Link to This Post
            
        
Beautiful 2 BR first floor apt, big living room with a built-in air conditioner, re-decorated eat-in kitchen with refrigerator, stove and lots of cabinet space. Both bedrooms have double closets and hardwood floors. There is one assigned parking space included, shared porches and a storage locker and laundry in the basement. Close to Wauwatosa, major bus lines and easy access to downtown. Building has a history of good long-term tenants. Security deposit is $725. Available between Nov. 15 and Dec. 1st. Pictures are not the actual apt that will be available but are very similar to it. The biggest difference is the color of the appliances, instead of white, the stove is black and the refrigerator is stainless steel.

During the worst of COVID-19, I started doing pre-screening and private showings to limit everyone's exposure to it. I found this approach to be more effective and efficient than my old method of having an "open house" so I have decided to continue it even though COVID-19 is less of and issue than it was then. If you are reading this ad, the apt is still available. 
Please reply by email if you have more questions or are interested in providing the information I need to pre-screen. If you prefer to discuss the apt by phone you can call Jerry at 262-789-86twotwo, however, all pre-screen info needs to be given via email.

Info needed for pre-screen (you can copy this, hit "reply" above the ad title, then paste and fill it out in your email reply, please provide the info for each adult who will be residing at apt):

-Full name and birth date of each adult who will be residing at apt ________________________
-Name(s) and age(s) of child(ren) that will be living with you____________________________
-Current address________________________How long?_________Your phone #_____________
-Landlord name and contact info_________________________________________
-Current Employer_______________Starting date_______Gross Monthly Income______
Employer Address and Phone #___________________________ Job Title____________
-Additional Monthly income and source___________________________________

After doing the pre-screening I will contact the applicants who are likely to be approved to schedule a private showing.

Some of the Qualifications:
*Must be 18 years or over
*Must have at least $2200/Mo in verifiable household gross income
*Bring Photo ID to showing, also having proof of income at that time will expedite an application
*Be able to get WE Energies in your name
*Able to pay FULL Security deposit within a day of application approval
*No evictions in past 10 yrs.

Property is owned by a WI Licensed Real Estate Broker

      Must be IN ADDITION to parents' information

The above items are needed for a complete application.

Say ''Hello'' to this beautiful move-in ready 2 bedroom, 2 full bathroom condo in the desirable Vistas at Rivertown Park condominiums. Located less than 2 miles from Rivertown Crossing mall, restaurants and shops make this perfect for any lifestyle!  Walking in you will notice the bright and welcoming eat-in area and living room and spacious kitchen. The kitchen features all stainless steel appliances. snack bar and granite countertops. Moving through you will find the living room with a walkout balcony and beautiful views of your backyard. The inviting, primary suite will not disappoint, including an ensuite bathroom and plenty of closet space, along with laundry and storage! As you walk down to the basement you will find the family room with a wet bar, second bedroom and bathroom. This home has an attached one stall garage and has been wonderfully updated throughout! Text2: 4 BR 2.5 Bath House for Rent
Text3:
QR Code Link to This Post
            
        
Located in between downtown and Broad Ripple.  Only 10 min bike ride to Butler University and a 10 min drive to both Broad Ripple and Bottleworks District!  On Red Line bus route and in walking distance to other city bus to other city bus route stops.  Walking distance to State Fair found, Nextdoor and “root and bone” restaurants.  Convenient to shopping, Children’s Museum, Ivy Tech, restaurants, groceries and city library is just few houses away.  

Finished full basement including family room with a mini snack kitchen area and built-in cabinets/bookshelves, 3rd bathroom with large marble around raised Jacuzzi soaking bath tub, a guest bedroom with sitting/office area.  

Except 2 decorative windows and 3 windows in dining room,  all of the windows are the top grade Pella energy efficient windows.  

3  very large bedrooms (13’x16’, 12’x16’, 12’x13’) on 2nd floor with walking-in closet and good size updated bathroom (8’x9’) on 2nd floor.  

First floor includes large living room (13’x17’) with gas log fireplace and bright Sun room (8’x17’) connected. Very large dining room (14’x18’) with chandelier next to the kitchen (12’x13’) and a half bathroom (5’x5’).  Kitchen is equipped with stainless steel appliances, built-in microwave with exhaust fan.  Front load washer and dryer are in laundry room next to the kitchen on first floor.

Fully fenced big backyard with matured huge shading trees, a concrete paver patio by back door.  Lilac, rose of Sharon, Lilly, tea roses and many perennials in front garden.

Text2: If you've thought about putting an end to renting or looking to downsi
Text3:
QR Code Link to This Post
            
        
If you've thought about putting an end to renting or looking to downsize, this great home is ready for you. The large entry way/mud room welcomes you home and provides lots of space to unload after a long day. The large family room is a great place for entertaining and hanging out with family and friends.
"       

I’m looking for a quiet and clean room to call home. I’m a 34 year-old . My favorite kind of music is classical. I like sports, movies, travel, reading, writing. I work as an administrative assistant for a medical company and I’m returning to college for this Winter. I also have an inactive startup that I’m working on. I’m very quiet, clean, and respectful. A reference from my current renter of 1 year is available if necessary.

Ideally, I’m looking for a place in Manhattan, preferably around Central Park. However, any other borough would do except the Bronx. I know my funds are limited at this time of the year but I’m a great roommate and dependable friend if you ever need one. I’m also flexible and we could further discuss any amounts down the line if needed.

I don’t do drugs or drink aside from the occasional beer or glass of wine. I’m a Duke fan and love science/spirituality.

Anyways, feel free to give me a call or email me through here. I’m very responsive.

Thanks!Single professional in her forties seeks a studio or 1 bedroom in Fairfield or New Haven County. I have no pets, I’m responsible and tidy. I’m looking for a place to rent just for myself. I can provide references. Ideally, I’d like spend no more than $1600.0054 yo CD looking to barter for a room (Poughkeepsie)
After nearly finding my ideal place twice before the pandemic I'm starting my search again. I'm looking for November time frame. I can meet with you beforehand to establish we're both sane and serious, and then ultimately look at the place.

So I'm CJ, I'm a single 54 y/o petite, fem CD who is looking for a nice clean room with preferably my own bath. Ideally in a more private, quiet location, but will consider all. Please no cats as I'm highly allergic. I'm honest, responsible, drama free, employed part time and would respect your property as if it were my own. I'm living with and helping to take care of elderly parents hence my need for a little ""me"" space. No illegal drugs, social drinker only, clean, neat and easy to get along with. I'm looking for Poughkeepsie or within a 20 - 30 min. radius. I would only be there 2 weeks a month on an every other week basis, and I would only be there 3 days a week. I'm looking for a barter situation and have several skill sets so if you can think of a few chores I can do feel free to mention. If you have something available please get in touch as I would love to discuss, and ultimately find something. Thanks guys.I am looking for a studio apartment or a one bedroom apartment either in a apartment building or in a residential home. I’m currently on a tight budget. I can only afford to pay for rent between $700.00-$1000.00. The most I can afford to pay rent is up to $1000.00 I am actively looking for a place. Will be for myself and my love one. For 2 people only. I am looking for a long term rental. I’m looking for a place in the Bronx in the following zip codesPride of ownership. Very well cared for 3-bedroom 2.5 bath ranch style home is very homy and comfortable. Tucked away at the end of a quiet street, but convenient to grocery stores, train, restaurants and schools. Large living room with fireplace, good size bright three bedrooms, den/dining room leading to a beautiful level yard. Gleaming hardwood floor throughout. Lower level family room has an access to luxurious updated bathroom and one car garageMy partner and I are both in our thirties working full time in the Bourne area. My partner is a nurse at a detox facility and I manage a local coffee shop. We would love to find a year round 1-2 bedroom apartment for $2100 or less. We'd prefer to keep our commute to work under 30 minutes. We have no pets, no , and don't smoke. If anybody has a lead on a place we'd appreciate if you contacted us! Thank you for taking the time to read this :)Looking for a 2 bedroom, 2 bathroom temporary home for me and my business partner in the area. He would move in so we can search for property to buy and work on as investment.

He would move in immediately, and I would come in January.

I have a dog so needs to be pet friendly.

I own property in Washington State and manage AirBnB properties. Looking to expand on the east coast after the holidays. I need my business partner to use that time to start a list of potential investments when I arrive.

No problem with background check, credit check or drug tests. Responsible and reliable.Hello! I'm a thirtysomething trans (she/her), who is in an urgent housing situation and looking for a safe/quiet room back in Northampton.
My budget is ideally around $500-600, but I have guaranteed income, so that is flexible.

I lived in NoHo for a bit until recently, when I trusted the wrong stranger from a housing group and moved about a half hour away, right into an increasingly unsafe situation.
The landlord offered to let me out of the lease with 30 days notice since they're aware. I would move before that (if poss) but still pay them my obligations.

I have a beautiful tuxedo kitty (my emotional support animal) named Paul. I can provide documentation for his ESA status if necessary. He has always stayed with me in my room & is kept clean, with an air purifier next to his litterbox. He's my only family & I'd never abandon him.

I'm respectful of space & others, am always genuine, fairly quiet, and practice good hygiene. My passions are creative typically, so I spend a lot of time writing & making art. I plan to go back to social work again, but it's been very difficult without any stability as of the past few months. I am vaxxed/boosted.

I have never felt as safe and accepted in my life as I have in NoHo, ever, and being trans, that means the literal world to me. I just want to be back home. Please feel free to message, and thank you!I'm looking for a reasonably affordable room to rent, I'm a 38 year old , my occupation is a traveling private health care provider. The place I am currently residing will no longer be available by the end of December. I do have a cat, and would like for him to be able to join me.Veteran in wheelchair coming to area for 2023 Saratoga horses! Dates August 9th thru the 13th! Flying into Albany from Las Vegas morning of the 9th! Would really prefer to be in Saratoga if possible! Obviously need downstairs access, leaving August 13th from Albany! Not needing anything special just a warm clean bed! Please reply if u can accommodate! 72 yr old !I am looking for a room rental in NYC. I am a 43yo gay currently working as an audience coordinator at a talk show. I am clean, courteous, respectful and responsible. I live in Washington Heights at the moment and am looking for a change. Excellent references available. I can afford up to $600 including utilities.Short term (?) room needed for mature, flexible & personable professional moving back to NY

Please no brokers / middle-persons / otherwise fee generating services/companies.

Single (straight) Black , mid 50’s, **no drama**, **super** quiet and **fastidiously** clean (drugs & disease free (*very* rarely drinks)), *non-smoker*, *very* personable former I.T. Project Manager (that needed a break from I.T.) is moving back to NY after being a live-in companion/attendant for a special needs (cerebral palsy, manic depression, bi-polar disorder, ADHD, high-functioning autism) young adult outside of NY state. This live-in arrangement is ending at the end of November 2022.

I am moving back to NY alone. I am fully COVID-19 vaccinated (Moderna). I have no problem wearing masks if necessary. I fully & strongly believe in consideration of others as well as their space.

As I am out of state, I’d hoped effective communication and video walk-throughs would help overcome the logistical challenges. I hope you agree. Real/serious inquiries only - I have experienced the ""Craigslist effect"" far too often during this search - so if I am exceedingly wary, I hope you understand.

I am *initially* looking for a short term/low-cost room rental starting November 30/December 1 2022, until I can find a more permanent arrangement (I will only have a backpack (or perhaps a small duffel) and possibly a small suitcase). If this arrangement benefits both parties and you are amenable to it being more than a short-term arrangement, I am *very* open to this possibility.
I will not look a gift horse in the mouth if a dynamic possibility should present itself! :)
I am also *very* open to work exchange (I am a diligent and hard worker).I have lived at my present residence for 20 plus years. Landlords have changed and not for the good. The previous two were awesome! I do have two well trained cats 12 years old that I would need to take! I have a real reasonable rate on my rent since I have been here for so long! I pay my own utilities, and garbage. Preferably would need two to three small bedrooms. I do work f/t in Malta, NY, my wife works also! I do have a medical condition I'm willing to discuss at the right opportunity!

Willing to discuss what I am currently paying & willing to pay now!!! Must be a clean area and quiet, that's how my wife and i like it!30-year-old Trans student early in their transition looking for a safe, comfortable and accepting environment. I'm open to living with both sexes, men preferable as legally I still am one, but we can discuss, of similar age and interests. It's no longer best for me to stay where I'm at currently, I live alone for the past 10 years, but looking to form better relationships and not feel as lonely or stressed both personally and financially.

I'm kind, clean, dependable and creative
I love all kinds of music and movies and TV shows
I enjoy conversation on a variety of topics, politics is fine with me
I like to cook
I love to eat LOL
Love walking on hikes or the beach

Full disclosure, i do have a housing voucher and am currently looking to increase my streams of income ASAP, I'm willing to discuss this more in detail as i make potential matches with folks. But wanted to be upfront as i am also ready to move on from benefits.

I'm open to a house share
I'm hoping over time to have a cat or dog, i hope this will be acceptable
In need of housing as winter approaches-
I am a young 21yr old mother to a four yr old boy I homeschool and am currently pregnant by my 24yr old boyfriend;
He has worked for ARC full time and I have security & have a few months forward of rent with DSS assistance, we have no animals, we don’t smoke, and we were hoping to rent a two bedroom but anything is worth it-
We could afford to pay up to $1,000/mo
and I was hoping if any kind landlord has availability to please consider working with our family on getting a rental apartment/home.
Much appreciation for you reading this; blessingsI am looking for an appt (or sublet) for a single person, 45 y.o.w. . Clean, quiet, respectful, responsible. A large studio (or 1 bedroom). Large loft with high ceilings and lots of windows on two sides would be ideal (up to $2200 with electricity included). Don't care much about kitchen (a fridge and a microwave is all I need). Don't care much about bathroom either. Don't need furniture. It would be nice to have a couch and a bed but nothing else (I will decorate the place myself). Looking for a year lease. Have a guarantor. Must be cat friendly. Upper West Side is the best. UES or around central Park is fine. Higher than first floor. Balcony is a big plus. Need the place by December or mid January.
Thank you.
With Mettã.Hello! I'm looking to do a housing swap in New York or New Jersey for my room in my spacious Los Angeles apartment. My intended dates are Nov 23 - December 23rd. I live in a two bedroom on Melrose hill (koreatown / hollywood border) with my roomie/brother. The place is extremely central, 10-15 minutes to Silverlake, Echo Park, West Hollywood, Sunset blvd and we are right on top of the hill so our balcony has the view of the Hollywood sign, Griffith Park and surrounding areas.
You'd be living with Ignacio (28) and our cat, Renoir. He will be home for the first three weeks of December, then going home for the holidays around the 22nd. Open to talking about exact dates. Our house is our sanctuary so ideally we can become great friends and we'll care for each other's house as if it were our own. I'm looking for a place in New York that has a somewhat easy path to get to Montclair, New Jersey or somewhere in New Jersey with the same idea as I will be working on a film shooting in Montclair every weekday starting at 6 am. Please holler/ share if this sounds like we complete each other's wishes. :)Stop sending me nasty emails, im not interested in anything other than finding a rental.
Single mom of 2 small in search of an affordable 1 to 2 bedroom rental. Posting again in hopes that someone will help us out. I have a full time job, good credit and no evictions on my record. I have a pet bird that I would be moving with as well. We will take a shack, a bungalow, a small trailer, anything at this point. I take care of my on my own with no financial help from their dad and im trying really hard to pull myself onto my own two feet.
I would prefer to stay in orange county but im willing to travel to Sullivan or ulster.
Please let me know if you have something or know of something available. Im ideally looking for a rental no more than $1,200 a month. Thank you.Mature carpenter looking for room to rent with kitchen priviliges and off street parking. I'm looking for a room to rent for a month or 2 possibly more. I'm a 30 year member of the Connecticut Carpenters Union currently working on a job in the area. I'm from Connecticut but now reside in Maine near Sunday River Ski Resort. The job I am on now will go at least until the end of the year. Possibly longer. I am a non smoker and allergic to pets so the home would have to be pet & smoke free. Some cats I am ok with. I have been a caretaker & managed rental property myself. I can also do work & chores for a deduction or in exchange for rent. I look forward to hearing from you.

If you have a small family (2-3 members) who want run a family based pet kennel business, you can just rent the first floor (which has 1 br 1bath, 1 living room, 1 small kitchen, plus 2 car garage) as office and customer reception area. Cozy 1 bedroom apartment available in the Washington Heights area, near 90th/May.   Hardwood floors, ceramic tile bath, appliances, quiet building and quiet block. Rent is $800/Month plus tenant pays own heat and utilities. You will need first and second month's rent plus $500 (non-refundable) Move In Fee (or a total of $2100 to move in). Working, Fixed Income, or Section 8 ok..  

LOCATION: 1118 W 90th St., Chicago, IL 60620   

**TO SEE UNIT, Please email, call or text 708.314.5333 to set up a showing. 

MUST HAVE:
*Full Time Job or Fixed Income
*2 Year Job History (unless you have a Fixed Income)
*2 Year Rental History
*Minimum Income $2400/Month
*Active Checking Account (preferred, but not required)
*No Criminal Background
*No Evictions or Bankruptcies in the last 3 years
*No Dogs

To fill out an application, PLEASE BRING:
*State ID or DL
*Proof of income for the last 30 days or Award Letter
*Social Security Card
*$35 Application Fee for Each Adult

PLEASE NOTE,
If your application is accepted, within 24 hours you will need Second Month's Rent Plus Move in fee, or $1300 to hold the unit. Then First Month's Rent, or $800 when you move in (or a total of $2100 for move in). It is preferred (but not required) that you have an active checking account in order to use ZELLE QUICKPAY to pay your rent on a monthly basis.

Text2: House Home for rent, 3 bed, 1 bath
Text3:
QR Code Link to This Post
            
        
Please read the entire ad.  Reply as directed at end.

House for rent near 36th Street and Buchanan Avenue.
Three bedrooms.  One bathroom, remodeled 2 years ago-new floor/toilet/vanity.
Kitchen with small eating area.  Stainless steel stove/above range microwave and refrigerator.
Living/family rooms, one on either side of the kitchen.
Entire house is 884 sf.
All rooms were just painted, new carpet in bedrooms.
Washer and dryer in basement that you may use.  Not responsible for repair or replacement if break down.
No pets-No cats, no dogs.
No smoking.  This means a tenant who does not smoke anywhere/any time.  Not interested in someone who only smokes at work, in their car, outside, etc.  Non-smoker only.
Two car detached garage.
Fenced in backyard w gate, corner lot so fair amount of yard.
Rent includes trash disposal.  Tenant responsible for gas (water heater/dryer/furnace), electric, and water.
Water heater and furnace are both a few years old, efficient.
Weekly grass cutting, trimming, bi-monthly sidewalk edging and fertilizer is included in rent.
Tenant is responsible for general maintenance of the yard-pulling weeds from flower beds, picking up trash, raking leaves, and shoveling sidewalks.
Two blocks from Godwin Heights HS and across the street from North Godwin Elementary School.
Kids drop candy wrappers, soda cans, etc on their way to school-fair amount since across the street.  You must be willing to keep the yard picked up even though you didn't put it there.  Since across from school there is a lot of traffic in the morning and mid-afternoon.  A few cars will park in the street along side of house during school.  Weekends and summer there are no cars.

I am not doing an open house.  After contacting interested individuals and getting more info I will select a few to tour the home.
Lease is one year, month-to-month thereafter. Security deposit is same as rent/$1,600.
Section 8 is accepted.

Please reply to CL email with the following:
Full name?
Where living now? (house/apartment), how long there? current rent?
Who would reside in the home?, if kids how many?
Where working/position? how long employed there? current salary?
All info will be verified if move forward-please be honest.
Thank you.

Text2: $950 Cozy Two Bedroom apartment in Chicago (Pilsen Area)
Text3:
QR Code Link to This Post
            
        
Great Location, Corner of 18th Street and Racine Avenue.

Cozy Two bedroom apartment, hardwood floors. Lots of natural light. Facing 18th street, great view of the Chicago Skyline. Kitchen, living room and two smaller bedrooms - one can be used as a walk-in closet or office space. First few pics are of the empty apartment, the others include our tenants items so you visualize the space.

Rent is $950/month, utilities are separate. We can offer a discount if only one individual. Landlord pays for water and trash. Tenant pays for heat and light.

Located in the Pilsen neighborhood. Very close to the Loop, UIC, Orange Line, Blue Line, Pink Line and all expressways. Located on the corner of 18th and Racine, in the heart of all the stores, restaurants & bars that 18th Street has to offer. Very clean, brick building, secure apartment, long term tenants. Owner is always available if you have any issues; building has two entrances and exits.

One year lease, one month rent and $400 Move In Fee due at signing. Landlord will conduct a credit and background check.

Please contact us if you would like to stop by and see the apartment.

Thank you for looking.

This building is Smoke Free and Pet Free.

Text2: Great 2 BR Apt
Text3:
QR Code Link to This Post
            
        
Beautiful 2 BR first floor apt, big living room with a built-in air conditioner, re-decorated eat-in kitchen with refrigerator, stove and lots of cabinet space. Both bedrooms have double closets and hardwood floors. There is one assigned parking space included, shared porches and a storage locker and laundry in the basement. Close to Wauwatosa, major bus lines and easy access to downtown. Building has a history of good long-term tenants. Security deposit is $725. Available between Nov. 15 and Dec. 1st. Pictures are not the actual apt that will be available but are very similar to it. The biggest difference is the color of the appliances, instead of white, the stove is black and the refrigerator is stainless steel.

During the worst of COVID-19, I started doing pre-screening and private showings to limit everyone's exposure to it. I found this approach to be more effective and efficient than my old method of having an "open house" so I have decided to continue it even though COVID-19 is less of and issue than it was then. If you are reading this ad, the apt is still available.
Please reply by email if you have more questions or are interested in providing the information I need to pre-screen. If you prefer to discuss the apt by phone you can call Jerry at 262-789-86twotwo, however, all pre-screen info needs to be given via email.

Info needed for pre-screen (you can copy this, hit "reply" above the ad title, then paste and fill it out in your email reply, please provide the info for each adult who will be residing at apt):

-Full name and birth date of each adult who will be residing at apt ________________________
-Name(s) and age(s) of child(ren) that will be living with you____________________________
-Current address________________________How long?_________Your phone #_____________
-Landlord name and contact info_________________________________________
-Current Employer_______________Starting date_______Gross Monthly Income______
Employer Address and Phone #___________________________ Job Title____________
-Additional Monthly income and source___________________________________

After doing the pre-screening I will contact the applicants who are likely to be approved to schedule a private showing.

Some of the Qualifications:
*Must be 18 years or over
*Must have at least $2200/Mo in verifiable household gross income
*Bring Photo ID to showing, also having proof of income at that time will expedite an application
*Be able to get WE Energies in your name
*Able to pay FULL Security deposit within a day of application approval
*No evictions in past 10 yrs.

Property is owned by a WI Licensed Real Estate Broker

Picturesque views, fences, well-groomed lawns, glistening lakes and Colonial-style architecture showcase homes of distinction at Abney Lake. Whether you’re looking for a one or two bedroom apartment or two or three bedroom town home, you’ll appreciate the incredible views, beautiful lakes, calming fountains and quality construction. Amenities like fireplaces and washer dryer connections make Abney Lake feel like home from the very first day. The community features carports, sparkling pool and sun deck, tennis court, fitness center, clubhouse, three playgrounds, covered picnic area and wireless hot spot for your convenience and enjoyment. Abney Lake is only minutes from shopping, downtown, universities, hospitals, and the airport with immediate access to I-65. Visit us today, you’ll be glad you did!

With the Kalamazoo 10 theater and Maple Hill Mall a brisk walk away, dinner with friends at Applebee’s followed by the latest flick could become your new favorite pastime. Come enjoy each day when you call Summer Ridge, home.

Text2: Large 3-4 bedroom half of duplex
Text3:
QR Code Link to This Post
            
        
Large, 3-4 Bedroom, 1.5 bathroom apartment, about 1650 square feet.  The apartment is half of a duplex on the north side of Madison, near Warner Park, Cherokee Marsh, Northside Willy Coop, Madison College, and Dane County Airport. To UW-Madison campus it's a 15-20 minute drive without traffic.

Living room, eat-in kitchen  and a half bath on the main level. 
Upstairs Bedrooms: One huge bedroom (14' x 25'),  two good-sized bedrooms (10' x 12', 12' x 12'), also a small bedroom (7' x 11') that could be used as a small office.  Full bath upstairs.

Big eat-in kitchen with dishwasher, disposal, cabinets with roll-out storage.  Free private washer /dryer in basement storage and laundry area. 

Many energy efficiency upgrades including some new windows.  New high efficiency furnace and water heater. Newer central air. Ceiling fans in two bedrooms. 

Rent is $1950, which  includes the water utility. Tenant pays gas and electric. 
Lease renews August 1, 2023 for one year. We would consider short-term renters from January until July 2023.

Quiet neighbors. Kids and good pets welcome. Extra pet deposit is required, refundable if no damage done. 

Large yard, great spot for someone interested in gardening. Plenty of garden space. Patio in the back yard, shared with the other side of the duplex.

Snow shoveling and lawn mowing are required (mower supplied). Duties are split with tenants on the other side of the duplex.  Parking in one side of a two car garage, plus room for a second car in the driveway. Sorry, absolutely no smoking.

Available January 1, 2023.

Before scheduling a showing you must pre-qualify.
Your combined household income must be over $5800 gross monthly. (~3X the rent)
We require excellent credit history (score over 700)
We prefer tenants who love to garden, who are quiet, who conserve energy, and who value sustainable apartment living.

Feel free to contact us if we can answer any questions. If the ad is still posted, the unit is still available.


If you value sustainability, this is an apartment for you! We are co-founders of the green apartment network, a small association for green-minded property owners and green-minded tenants. We promote sustainable apartment living. We encourage gardening, value energy efficiency,  use many recycled and reused materials, and we support local businesses. We look for tenants with similar values.

This house is in the DeForest Area School District.

Welcome to Harbor Pointe Apartments, a great place to call home. Our quiet community is nestled on the shores of scenic Granville Lake just minutes from the Brown Deer and Bayshore shopping districts. Our pet-friendly community is an ideal setting to call home. We offer a full range of Studio, 1, 2 & 3-bedroom apartment homes to fit your unique needs. Choose our classic Milwaukee apartments or a townhome with a private entry and garage. Regardless of your needs, our dedicated leasing staff is eager to assist you and show you a better style of living! Living at Harbor Pointe is like condo living without any of the hassles. Our 24-hour emergency maintenance is on call waiting to assist you. The community grounds are professionally maintained. Take a walk through our lush, manicured grounds along our paved jogging paths and enjoy the beauty of nature within the metro area. Hop in our heated indoor pool and take a few laps, or simply let our whirlpool's jets massage away the strain of the workout you'll get in our 2 fully equipped fitness rooms! Enjoy entertainment options that include, American Family Field, The Milwaukee Art Museum, and Downtown Milwaukee with all the best attractions of a big city just a short drive away. Local restaurants include Cafe Hollander, Libby Montana Bar & Grill, and Rocky Rococo. Our leasing professionals look forward to scheduling your personalized tour of your new home and showing you how we are making Harbor Pointe the place to live.

Text2: Charming, Peaceful Country Apartment
Text3:
QR Code Link to This Post
            
        
Looking for a charming, safe, peaceful place to live, in one of the prettiest areas in Dane County?  If so, you’ll love this one-of-a-kind, recently constructed, lower-level apartment, located beneath a 22-year-old, private residence.  Situated on an 8-acre hilltop parcel in the rolling hills between Verona and New Glarus, this apartment offers solitude, windows on three sides, and views of a small valley.  Beautiful vistas make this a great area for long walks or bike rides. And you'll love the abundant wildlife. 

- 550 SF - The perfect size for a single tenant
- Rent includes heat, electric, water and trash pick-up
- Private at-grade entrance and concrete patio
- Lots of character
- Wood floors in livingroom and bedroom
- Washer and dryer in unit
- Off-street parking for one car
- Available Dec. 1st
- 12-month lease required
- Cat(s) considered, with higher security deposit  
- Owner-landlord and wife live in the house above 
- Smoking not permitted in apartment or anywhere on the property
- Located 13 miles southwest of Verona 5 miles north of New Glarus, and 12 miles southeast of Mt. Horeb.  Easy commutes on recently paved county highways. 

Looking for a long term, stable, considerate tenant.
Employment and prior landlord references required.

- Hardwood floors and crown moulding throughout
- Gourmet granite & stainless steel kitchen open to dining room
- Kitchen has microwave, pantry, new dishwasher & new french door fridge
- Three queen size bedrooms with big, organized closets

- Tenant pays cooking gas, electricity & WIFI
- Street parking but $150 month parking available at end of block
- Cats OK, sorry no dogs
- Agent owned

No security deposit required. $300 move-in fee per applicant.

Our friendly staff greets you with a smile and conversation with neighbors turn into regular play dates for the kids. Fresh green grass hugs the walking trails in our backyard, leading you by two peaceful ponds.Here, even home is a sanctuary within itself: cathedral ceilings, walk-in closets, and a washer and dryer to put your mind at ease. Plus, with major employers like Kellogg’s and Borgess Medical Center a short commute away and shopping and restaurants nearby, everywhere you need to be lies close at hand. As the sun sinks beneath the horizon, settle in to watch the stars pierce the night sky. Rest easy in the home you’ve always hoped to find, here in Battle Creek.

Text2: Stunning 2BR in UK Village: backyard, garage parking, now PET-FRIENDLY
Text3:
QR Code Link to This Post
            
        
Be the first lucky tenant to live in this beautiful, freshly renovated 2-BR, 1-bath apartment. The unit is located on the first floor of a tree-filled, family-friendly residential block, a tranquil oasis just a few minutes from bustling Chicago Avenue. Mariano’s grocery store, coffee shops, and a wide variety of fun bars and restaurants are all less than five minutes away. For nature enthusiasts, you are also just two blocks from the tennis courts, a public swimming pool, and the sprawling, lush greenery of Smith Park.

The unit has been completely updated and includes the following:
- Brand-new 42-inch Shaker cabinets, quartz countertops, LED light fixtures, and luxury vinyl floors
- Soaring, nearly 10 foot ceilings and large front windows that let in expansive natural light
- Large closets in each bedroom
- Free laundry, located just outside of the apartment
- Dishwasher
- Shared access to a spacious backyard that is already equipped with outdoor furniture
- Free and abundant street parking, with garage parking available for an additional fee

Tenants must have renter's insurance, and provide EITHER 1) a security deposit equal to one month's rent OR 2) a $400 non-refundable move-in fee upon lease signing. Can do six-month or 12-month lease. Pets are welcome with one-time $250 fee per dog and $150 fee per cat. 

**Note: Some images have been digitally enhanced to represent how the rooms will look with new furniture. The unit does not come furnished.**

Text2: Thrifty Bungalow
Text3:
QR Code Link to This Post
            
        
BROAD RIPPLE. The Greenwich Village of Indianapolis! Are you looking for an upscale lifestyle on a shoe-string budget? Here's a small, economical, two-bedroom bungalow only a few minutes away from the popular Indianapolis northside dining and entertainment district -- an area that is holding up admirably during the post-pandemic. 

The Thrifty Bungalow is a petite Eisenhower-era house, almost seventy years old, with a big yard, front and back, and space on all sides. Passthrough street traffic is light, and the neighbors are both friendly and respectful of privacy.

CONVENIENT. It's just a block west off Keystone at 69th Street, in a quiet. tree-lined neighborhood. It offers all the advantages of urban living and convenient shopping, with Broad Ripple's attractive stores, restaurants, and night clubs right around the corner.

AMENITIES. This was a solid, G.I.-loan-type house built back in the 1950s, and it's been carefully preserved ever since. The floors are hardwood, and the bathroom is tiled. It has also been updated, with new HVAC and gas furnace installed in 2018, and a new water heater added in the same year.

ACCOMMODATING. 800 square feet of floor space. Refinished kitchen cabinets, refinished sliding windows, electric range & refrigerator. Shelving in utility room, bathroom cabinets. Wired for cable-TV and broadband. Recently installed washer and dryer. The house is smoke-free and has been so for many years.

COMFORTABLE. Living room, kitchen, one bath, two bedrooms, utility porch. One linen closet, one coat closet, one clothes closet in each of the two bedrooms. Built-in bookshelf. Detached one-car garage with storage space and automatic overhead door. Paved driveway. Large, level back yard.

LOW MAINTENANCE. During renovation a few years ago, the landlord installed attic insulation, crawlspace insulation, new storm windows, new breaker box, new wiring, new gas lines. It all adds up to incredibly low utility bills year-round, and a trouble-free, day-to-day lifestyle.

GETTING AROUND. By car, eight minutes to Broad Ripple Park and Library, ten minutes to Broad Ripple Village, half an hour to downtown Indy and IUPUI. A few blocks either way on Keystone and you'll find Kroger, Wal-Mart, Sullivan's Hardware, Dairy Queen, McDonald's, Glendale Shopping Center, Lowe's, Meijer, Aldi, and dozens of budget and upscale restaurants.

ABOUT PETS. One cat OK. A small dog (10 pounds or less) will be considered, but will require extra fees and/or additional security deposit, depending on breed, size, age, weight, temperament, etc. The back yard is fenced only on the east side.

REASONABLE TERMS. Now available for only $1,200, due on the first of each month. Tenant agrees to sign a 12-month lease and to pay all utilities. The smoke-free requirement is not negotiable. One month's rent and equivalent one-month security deposit (total of $2,400) will be required in advance before the move-in.

OPTIONAL LAWN CARE. The tenant will coordinate with the city's weekly trash collectors and keep the property free of debris. Tenant is also responsible for mowing grass and any weeds, but a fee for alternative professional lawn care may be added to the deal.

APPLICATION AND LEASE. A printed application will be distributed to any interested party. If the application is accepted, the Lease/Rental Agreement must be agreed to and signed, and the security deposit and the first month's rent must have been received and successfully deposited by the landlord. Copies of the application and the Lease can be transmitted via e-mail.

CHECK IT OUT! It's the perfect place for a couple, or for a single professional needing to work from home and requiring office space. If you are looking for an alternative to cramped, noisy apartment existence & parking-space hassles, and you really want to find a thrifty, energy-efficient house, in a handy neighborhood, this is the place for you!

AVAILABILITY! Ready for immediate occupancy by 1 December 2022.

LIKE TO HAVE A LOOK? We recommend that you drive by the house, look it over, and check out the neighborhood, too. Get in touch with us via Craigslist, and we'll send you the address. If the outside looks OK, please let us know via Craigslist. We can arrange to show the interior almost any weekday or weekend afternoon. We will send you a cell-phone number, and between us we will set up an appointment.

Our historic, renovated 7 bedroom/3 bath multi-family home in Indianapolis Holly neighborhood is going to be available for rent.

BACKYARD - The house has an amazing backyard that you and your fur friends will love. We did a whole lot of pandemic gardening and grilling and socially distanced hosting here. There is also a storage shed.

LOCATION LOCATION - The house is within 5-10 minute walking distance of incredible coffee shops, bars, and restaurants such as Greater Goods, Kemuri Tatsuya, La BBQ, Vegan Nom, La Holly, Blue Owl Brewing, Juan in a Million, Suerte, Lazarus Brewing, Canje…and I really could go on and on.

And my favorite fact about our house is that it is less than a 0.5 mile away from the incredible Lady Bird hike/walk/run nature trail.

OTHER DETAILS - new A/C system, Washer-Dryer in unit, Gas Stove with oven, Dishwasher unit all included in the rent. The bathrooms were also recently remodeled. Located just 20 minutes outside of Downtown indianapolis, St. Johns is surrounded by Highway 290, Highway 183, and I-35, making it perfect for commuters. Welcome to Harbor Pointe Apartments, a great place to call home. Our quiet community is nestled on the shores of scenic Granville Lake just minutes from the Brown Deer and Bayshore shopping districts. Our pet-friendly community is an ideal setting to call home. We offer a full range of Studio, 1, 2 & 3-bedroom apartment homes to fit your unique needs. Choose our classic Milwaukee apartments or a townhome with a private entry and garage. Regardless of your needs, our dedicated leasing staff is eager to assist you and show you a better style of living! Living at Harbor Pointe is like condo living without any of the hassles. Our 24-hour emergency maintenance is on call waiting to assist you. The community grounds are professionally maintained. Take a walk through our lush, manicured grounds along our paved jogging paths and enjoy the beauty of nature within the metro area. Hop in our heated indoor pool and take a few laps, or simply let our whirlpool's jets massage away the strain of the workout you'll get in our 2 fully equipped fitness rooms! Enjoy entertainment options that include, American Family Field, The Milwaukee Art Museum, and Downtown Milwaukee with all the best attractions of a big city just a short drive away. Local restaurants include Cafe Hollander, Libby Montana Bar & Grill, and Rocky Rococo. Our leasing professionals look forward to scheduling your personalized tour of your new home and showing you how we are making Harbor Pointe the place to live.

Text2: Dog parks, Off Street Parking, Business Center
Text3:
QR Code Link to This Post
            
        
Welcome to Harbor Pointe Apartments, a great place to call home. Our quiet community is nestled on the shores of scenic Granville Lake just minutes from the Brown Deer and Bayshore shopping districts. Our pet-friendly community is an ideal setting to call home. We offer a full range of Studio, 1, 2 & 3-bedroom apartment homes to fit your unique needs. Choose our classic Milwaukee apartments or a townhome with a private entry and garage. Regardless of your needs, our dedicated leasing staff is eager to assist you and show you a better style of living! Living at Harbor Pointe is like condo living without any of the hassles. Our 24-hour emergency maintenance is on call waiting to assist you. The community grounds are professionally maintained. Take a walk through our lush, manicured grounds along our paved jogging paths and enjoy the beauty of nature within the metro area. Hop in our heated indoor pool and take a few laps, or simply let our whirlpool's jets massage away the strain of the workout you'll get in our 2 fully equipped fitness rooms! Enjoy entertainment options that include, American Family Field, The Milwaukee Art Museum, and Downtown Milwaukee with all the best attractions of a big city just a short drive away. Local restaurants include Cafe Hollander, Libby Montana Bar & Grill, and Rocky Rococo. Our leasing professionals look forward to scheduling your personalized tour of your new home and showing you how we are making Harbor Pointe the place to live.

Brand new, breathtaking Louisville apartments in Louisville, Kentucky.Brace yourself for a bold new take on what Louisville apartments should look and feel like. Exquisite. Stately. Stunning. This historic 3 bedroom, 2 baths, home with a full mostly finished basement and an attached 2 car garage is ready for a new owner. There is a main floor bedroom and 3 upstairs bedrooms but this home could EASILY be used as a 5 bedrooms home! The property record shows the entire basement to have an extra You will have LOTS of usable living space AND additional space for storage throughout the home. Wait until you see the bar room located in the basement! It is the ultimate at-home happy hour spot and it could be happy hour any time you want! Entertain away at this home! Situated on a large corner lot in a convenient Southeast neighborhood, this home boasts spacious rooms, beautiful wood flooring, newer carpeting, a new water heater in 2022, updated kitchen flooring in 2022, custom built-ins, French doors, high ceilings, an excellent layout, replacement windows, and so much more. Also, consistent with the design trends of the early 1900s, the kitchen has an attached passthrough pantry/kitchenette that leads to the dining room, which adds to the historic charm of this home.  Outside you will notice a beautiful lot, two drives, and a patio in the back that is perfectly private.If you interested send me your 📞📞 number or 📧📧 I will contract you. Welcome to Harbor Pointe Apartments, a great place to call home. Our quiet community is nestled on the shores of scenic Granville Lake just minutes from the Brown Deer and Bayshore shopping districts. Our pet-friendly community is an ideal setting to call home. We offer a full range of Studio, 1, 2 & 3-bedroom apartment homes to fit your unique needs. Choose our classic Milwaukee apartments or a townhome with a private entry and garage. Regardless of your needs, our dedicated leasing staff is eager to assist you and show you a better style of living! Living at Harbor Pointe is like condo living without any of the hassles. Our 24-hour emergency maintenance is on call waiting to assist you. The community grounds are professionally maintained. Take a walk through our lush, manicured grounds along our paved jogging paths and enjoy the beauty of nature within the metro area. Hop in our heated indoor pool and take a few laps, or simply let our whirlpool's jets massage away the strain of the workout you'll get in our 2 fully equipped fitness rooms! Enjoy entertainment options that include, American Family Field, The Milwaukee Art Museum, and Downtown Milwaukee with all the best attractions of a big city just a short drive away. Local restaurants include Cafe Hollander, Libby Montana Bar & Grill, and Rocky Rococo. Our leasing professionals look forward to scheduling your personalized tour of your new home and showing you how we are making Harbor Pointe the place to live.

Text2: Townhouse for Lease-KK Parkway (4336 W. Cleveland Ave.)
Text3:
QR Code Link to This Post
            
        
***Townhouse for Lease***

Enjoy living on the Kinnickinnic River Parkway.  This townhouse feels like living in a home and includes:

- Two bedrooms and 1-1/2 baths.
- An updated kitchen with skylight, ceramic range, refrigerator, dishwasher, and garbage disposal.
- Oak cabinets throughout.  Oak floors and woodwork.
- Private front and back entrances.  New storm doors and storm windows.
- New light fixtures throughout.  Recently painted throughout.
- Recently renovated main bath.
- Recent addition including 1/2 bath on first floor.
- Separate basement.

- Off-street parking for two cars.  (see below) 
- Beautiful backyard on KK parkway.  Residential area.
- Well-maintained outside.
- Exceptionally clean and bright inside.
- Hook-ups for washer and electric dryer.
- Hook-ups and wiring for Spectrum cable and internet available.
- Recently installed gas furnace.
- Convenient location near St. Luke's Hospital and Alverno College
- Easy access to shopping, the freeway, and bus lines.
- Owner is on-site for maintenance and yardwork.

Qualifications include:

- A completed application is required for each occupant 18 years and older.
- A current credit report (within the last 30 days) and references are required.
- A background check will be completed for each applicant.
- A credit rating of 650 or more.
- No evictions or unsatisfied money judgments within the last 5 years.
- Verifiable income or 3 times the monthly rent.
- One month security deposit and first month's rent due at lease signing.
- No pets.  No smoking/vaping unit.

- One year lease.
- Rent is $1,175 per month, plus gas and electric utilities.
- Owner pays water, sewer, and garbage collection charges.
- Some assistance with clearing of snow after major snow storms is expected. 
- No basement living/sleeping quarters allowed.
- Off-street parking is provided for two cars.  Sorry, due to space limits, no off-street parking provided for oversize cars, trucks or large SUVs; no vans; no commercial or business vehicles, etc. 

Contact by e-mail or phone (414) 321-zero 5 two 4 for details.  No texts.
PLEASE INCLUDE YOUR FULL NAME AND YOUR CONTACT PHONE NUMBER IN YOUR MESSAGE. 
Thank you.

Text2: One room for rent by Tower Grove, Dec 1
Text3:
QR Code Link to This Post
            
        
7-month room sublease (Dec 1st, 2022-- June 30th, 2023), with the option to stay month by month afterwards, by Missouri Botanical Garden. Price $465 per month. 

We (three grad students) are looking for one roommate who would like to occupy one bedroom, starting from Dec 1st, 2022. This is because one of our roommates is leaving at the end of Nov. Our address is 4448 Shaw Blvd. E., St. Louis, MO 63110. It's a four-bedroom, two-floored townhouse with a nice backyard, one block from the botanical garden. We welcome anyone interested, especially students/scholars. 

The room itself is on the first floor, and comes with its own spacious porch facing the backyard. Wood floors, zero carpet in the room. 

Super safe neighborhood, nice to walk to the beautiful Missouri Botanical Garden and the tower grove park. PLUS, you can get into the botanical garden at any time if you are a garden student. Close to the Hill Italian neighborhood, The Grove, and Manchester Ave, for plenty of bars and restaurants.

Grill and firepit for share in backyard. 
Central heat and central AC.
In-unit laundry is available. 
The BIG garden backyard is a bonus, you can plant whatever you want  
Utilities are not included in the price shown.
Public transport: Two of our roommates usually bike to washu in the summer. The closest metro is Central west end. There is a bus going to the metro right in front of our house (see last picture).

If interested, please contact  for more information.

Text2: Entire Home,Month to Month,Perfect DT Location,Fully Furnished,Parking
Text3:
QR Code Link to This Post
            
        
My father and I are looking to rent this cozy 2 bedroom home on a "medium term" (30 days or more) as we continue to upgrade the property between tenants and use it personally. This early 20th century home is ideal for traveling workers, students, or new Madison arrivals that need a place to stay while gathering their bearings. We are not some rigid slumlord company and have a family style approach to our small enterprise - thus we're happy to entertain any requests. The entire two bedroom house is available for rent - sorry, but we're not offering single bedrooms for rent. The price listed includes AT&T Fiber internet; however, the gas and water bill is not included in the price.

The house is a fully furnished, freshly renovated and tastefully decorated single family home located in a lovely lakeside neighborhood. It has a slow paced feel to it, yet it is very centrally located within walking and biking distance to everything Madison has to offer! Some highlights include: 65" 4K HDTV w/ Apple TV, Amazon FireStick and local channels in the living room; 500 mb/s AT&T fiber internet; washer and dryer in basement; a few older but functional bicycles; free off-street parking, and finally my passion for exceptional hospitality :-) I used to Airbnb this property and had Superhost status for 4 years and an average rating of 4.94 at this property before we switched to "medium term" rentals. Feel free to text or email me and we can arrange a time to get on a call!

Thanks for looking!

P.s. If you are reading this, a lease has not yet been finalized - I always take my postings down right away once I strike a deal :)

Text2: Fitness Center, Refrigerator, Public Transportation
Text3:
QR Code Link to This Post
            
        
Welcome to Harbor Pointe Apartments, a great place to call home. Our quiet community is nestled on the shores of scenic Granville Lake just minutes from the Brown Deer and Bayshore shopping districts. Our pet-friendly community is an ideal setting to call home. We offer a full range of Studio, 1, 2 & 3-bedroom apartment homes to fit your unique needs. Choose our classic Milwaukee apartments or a townhome with a private entry and garage. Regardless of your needs, our dedicated leasing staff is eager to assist you and show you a better style of living! Living at Harbor Pointe is like condo living without any of the hassles. Our 24-hour emergency maintenance is on call waiting to assist you. The community grounds are professionally maintained. Take a walk through our lush, manicured grounds along our paved jogging paths and enjoy the beauty of nature within the metro area. Hop in our heated indoor pool and take a few laps, or simply let our whirlpool's jets massage away the strain of the workout you'll get in our 2 fully equipped fitness rooms! Enjoy entertainment options that include, American Family Field, The Milwaukee Art Museum, and Downtown Milwaukee with all the best attractions of a big city just a short drive away. Local restaurants include Cafe Hollander, Libby Montana Bar & Grill, and Rocky Rococo. Our leasing professionals look forward to scheduling your personalized tour of your new home and showing you how we are making Harbor Pointe the place to live.

Text2: CHARMING COACH HOUSE, HUGE DECK
Text3:
QR Code Link to This Post
            
        
Light and bright, this two-story coach house cottage faces on a courtyard garden and is a perfect  romantic getaway right in the city. Upstairs is an airy 400-square-foot space with a cathedral ceiling, lighting inset into beams and oak floors laid on the diagonal. The kitchen, in one corner, features a 1963 Chambers stove and counter seating. A sliding glass door on the side opens onto a huge deck, while two sliding doors in front open onto a smaller balcony. The bedroom, also with oak floors, is downstairs and has closets across the back wall. Adjacent is a tiled bathroom and dressing area. The apartment has its own furnace; ask about heat and electric costs. 

Just minutes from the Mag Mile by bus (which stops on the corner) or bike, the neighborhood has gotten super trendy. Right around the corner on Chicago Avenue are nifty boutiques, two upscale wine shops, and close to a dozen restaurants, among them Noble Thai, Opart Thai, Jeong and Flo. Noble Square’s other attractions--all within walking distance--range from  Frontier on Milwaukee Ave. to Green Grocer, Bari Foods, D’Amato’s, Tempesta, and Coalfire on Grand Ave. The apartment also is across Noble St. from Eckhart Park, which has an indoor swimming pool. 

If you're looking for quirky charm, this is the place for you. If central air, in-unit laundry, and a dishwasher are deal-breakers, don't bother to apply.

If there’s ever a problem, the owner lives right next door.

This open-floor-plan loft apartment occupies the entire second level of a renovated horse barn.  Plus, there is a dedicated 150 square foot laundry and storage room on the first level with storage,  a utility sink, washer and dryer. The apartment has historically housed one or two individuals, has cathedral ceilings, plenty of large windows and is tucked-in next to woods and a small lake. The walls and cathedral ceilings are knotty pine; the floors are beautiful oak hardwood.  This like-new apartment has a full kitchen, full bath, natural gas forced-air heat, four large attractive ceiling fans, dishwasher hookups, two sets of large French doors and central AC. 

The barn and apartment are part of a family compound that sits on 3.3 acres with a small lake and is surrounded by 1,000 + acres of forever wild and farm land. This property is very secluded and private in all directions.   All this living space and privacy is just 10 minutes from the Northwestern Train line and downtown Crystal Lake and from Prairie Grove’s excellent schools.  $1500 / month plus gas and electric utilities. No Pets. No Smoking.  Available November 16.  One and one-half month rent security deposit plus first month’s rent.

Text2: Ideal location, vintage charm, heat included – Jan 1
Text3:
QR Code Link to This Post
            
        
This cream city brick building was built in 1900 by the Schlitz brewery as a dance hall & saloon.  Prohibition prompted its conversion to 1920’s era apartments.  The available 2 bedroom unit is on the second floor.  The apartment features natural light, a dining room, clawfoot tub with shower, ample closets, high ceilings and hardwood floors.  

The building provides a quiet environment and offers coin laundry, basement lockable storage and a shared back yard with a raised bed garden for your use.  

The Urban Ecology Center, free tennis courts and running track are directly across the street, as are access to the Oak Leaf bike trail, community garden plots, Riverside Park and the Rotary Arboretum.  The Riverside Milwaukee Recreation site is across the playing fields, offering inexpensive art, fitness and other classes and a pool.  The East Side is a highly walkable neighborhood with great restaurants, theaters, the East Library and shopping.  The building is near bus lines and a bike share station.  

Responsive local landlords live 4 blocks away.

Rent is $1260 per month including heat (steam radiators) and water.  Tenant pays for electricity and cooking gas.
Lease through July 31, 2023 with security deposit of $1,275.  Tenant can inquire about renewing with a 1-year lease beginning August 1, 2023.
A garage parking space is available for an additional $85/month.

No smoking  
No pets
We can't accept applicants with past citations for behaviors disturbing to neighbors (noise violations, underage drinking, disorderly conduct, etc.) or histories of nonpayment.

Feel free to e-mail with questions or to request a showing - masks required during in-person showings.  Must pass background and credit checks before lease is offered. ($39 per person paid online).

Please beware - there is a scam in which real ads are copied by a scammer who puts his or her own e-mail in place of the original poster’s contact information.  If photos are not provided or the rent is less than $1260, you are likely seeing this scam.  We will always ask to meet you in person and will not ask for your unencrypted e-mail address until after we have met.  Never make a payment for this rental until after you have met us.

Text2: 21 unit portfolio for SALE
Text3:
QR Code Link to This Post
            
        
Serious inquiries only! No wholesalers! Please be sure to put your contact info in your reply so I can reach back out to you.

21-home SFR portfolio scattered about in Montgomery, AL. There are eleven 2-bedroom, eight 3-bedroom, and two 4-bedroom homes. The average asking price per home of $57,142 is significantly below the average home sales price of $248,793 (April 2022) in Montgomery, AL according to Culverhouse College of Business. The seller purchased the homes one at a time over the past decade. Upon acquisition, the seller deployed the necessary capital to improve the homes. Improvements include kitchen and bath remodels, roofs and repairs, new HVAC units where needed, as well as cosmetic alterations during tenant turns. The homes are 100% occupied. Gross rents are a little over $14,000 a month. Many of the tenants have been in place for more than two years. The portfolio is self-managed providing an investor the opportunity to employ a professional management company to improve operational efficiencies. Another immediate value-add opportunity is raising rents on the month to-month tenants.

Text2: Great 2 BR Apt
Text3:
QR Code Link to This Post
            
        
Beautiful 2 BR first floor apt, big living room with a built-in air conditioner, re-decorated eat-in kitchen with refrigerator, stove and lots of cabinet space. Both bedrooms have double closets and hardwood floors. There is one assigned parking space included, shared porches and a storage locker and laundry in the basement. Close to Wauwatosa, major bus lines and easy access to downtown. Building has a history of good long-term tenants. Security deposit is $725. Available between Nov. 15 and Dec. 1st. Pictures are not the actual apt that will be available but are very similar to it. The biggest difference is the color of the appliances, instead of white, the stove is black and the refrigerator is stainless steel.

During the worst of COVID-19, I started doing pre-screening and private showings to limit everyone's exposure to it. I found this approach to be more effective and efficient than my old method of having an "open house" so I have decided to continue it even though COVID-19 is less of and issue than it was then. If you are reading this ad, the apt is still available.
Please reply by email if you have more questions or are interested in providing the information I need to pre-screen. If you prefer to discuss the apt by phone you can call Jerry at 262-789-86twotwo, however, all pre-screen info needs to be given via email.

Info needed for pre-screen (you can copy this, hit "reply" above the ad title, then paste and fill it out in your email reply, please provide the info for each adult who will be residing at apt):

-Full name and birth date of each adult who will be residing at apt ________________________
-Name(s) and age(s) of child(ren) that will be living with you____________________________
-Current address________________________How long?_________Your phone #_____________
-Landlord name and contact info_________________________________________
-Current Employer_______________Starting date_______Gross Monthly Income______
Employer Address and Phone #___________________________ Job Title____________
-Additional Monthly income and source___________________________________

After doing the pre-screening I will contact the applicants who are likely to be approved to schedule a private showing.

Some of the Qualifications:
*Must be 18 years or over
*Must have at least $2200/Mo in verifiable household gross income
*Bring Photo ID to showing, also having proof of income at that time will expedite an application
*Be able to get WE Energies in your name
*Able to pay FULL Security deposit within a day of application approval
*No evictions in past 10 yrs.

Property is owned by a WI Licensed Real Estate Broker

Text2: Beautiful home for rent on Spring Lake
Text3:
QR Code Link to This Post
            
        
Hi, 

This is a beautiful home for rent during the winter months on Spring Lake in Spring Lake, MI. The home normally rents as a VRBO short term rental during the summer months, where it rents for $559 a night, but it will be available September 2022 through the end of April 2023 as a longer term rental. 

The following is more information about the house:

5 Bedroom, 3 Full Baths, Sleeps 10, Beautiful Water View, Private large Boat Dock on Spring Lake and minutes from Grand Haven stores and beaches

3 smart TVs

LOWER LEVEL

*1 BR with an attached full bath

*Full Kitchen with an electric stove, dishwasher, coffee machine, toaster, microwave, dishes for 12.

*Laundry area, washer, and dryer

*Large Living room and 2 dining locations.

*Access to the beautiful outdoor deck and yard.

OUTDOORS

*Gorgeous 180 degree water view.

*Beautiful deck with outdoor furniture: table, chairs, picnic table, gas grill, back yard with loan

*Large dock to park your boat

*2 car garage to park your car

*Access to Spring Lake water.

UPPER LEVEL

*Master BR with a full bath

*3 more BRS and a full bath with twin beds.

Located 2 blocks away (walking distance) from main shops in Spring Lake and just 2.64 miles from channel and downtown Grand Haven, where you will find many fine shops, restaurants, and the State Park Beach, walk on the pier or ride a bike to the beautiful lighthouse. There are close to 65 different activities in nearby areas.

Thank you!

We offer pet-friendly 1- and 2-bedroom apartment homes that feature plenty of space, beautiful finishes and a quiet neighborhood filled with lush greenery. Text2: This 3 bedroom 2 bath ranch with nice size kitchen
Text3:
QR Code Link to This Post
            
        
Nice size kitchen with appliances and a mud room. Large shed for outdoor storage. Large clean with laundry room. And yes an attached garage. This 3 bedroom 2 bath ranch is conveniently located close to numerous shopping and restaurant options. Upon entering this home you'll find the living room with a wood beam cathedral ceiling and skylight. The kitchen and both full bathrooms were tastefully updated  Our community is very inviting with beautifully landscaped courtyards, There is one off-street parking space provided and an on-site laundry room for the 8 units. The lower apartments have enclosed patios - perfect for your small garden haven. (This apartment is a lower unit with a enclosed patio area.) The property is a short bike ride from Morley Field, which has a community pool and multitude of activities. Shopping and dining experiences abound in the neighborhood and nearby Hillcrest area. The building has been upgraded with all new double pane windows, paint, stucco, and roof. All these units have a hacienda old town feel with painted accent tiles in kitchen and accent tiles in shower. This unit features: Tile flooring throughout Natural wood interior doors White electric range Built in microwave Dishwasher Beautiful tiled shower with tub Dual pane windows Electric heat source Fans in each room Decently sized closet Each unit comes with 1 tandem carport parking space (2 cars deep) Small lockable storage in front of parking space.

Welcome to Harbor Pointe Apartments, a great place to call home. Our quiet community is nestled on the shores of scenic Granville Lake just minutes from the Brown Deer and Bayshore shopping districts. Our pet-friendly community is an ideal setting to call home. We offer a full range of Studio, 1, 2 & 3-bedroom apartment homes to fit your unique needs. Choose our classic Milwaukee apartments or a townhome with a private entry and garage. Regardless of your needs, our dedicated leasing staff is eager to assist you and show you a better style of living! Living at Harbor Pointe is like condo living without any of the hassles. Our 24-hour emergency maintenance is on call waiting to assist you. The community grounds are professionally maintained. Take a walk through our lush, manicured grounds along our paved jogging paths and enjoy the beauty of nature within the metro area. Hop in our heated indoor pool and take a few laps, or simply let our whirlpool's jets massage away the strain of the workout you'll get in our 2 fully equipped fitness rooms! Enjoy entertainment options that include, American Family Field, The Milwaukee Art Museum, and Downtown Milwaukee with all the best attractions of a big city just a short drive away. Local restaurants include Cafe Hollander, Libby Montana Bar & Grill, and Rocky Rococo. Our leasing professionals look forward to scheduling your personalized tour of your new home and showing you how we are making Harbor Pointe the place to live.

Text3:
QR Code Link to This Post
            
        
A pet kennel business house or other kind of business house/farm land/barn is now for rent. This business house/farm land/barn is in Carmel downtown, near Carmel high school, easy highway access. It has 5.63 acres farm land, a big house (1 br, 1 bath, 2 living room, 2 offices). plus a horse barn
Here is just an example using this house/farm land/barn as a pet kennel business (use your imagination to design other kind of business opportunity):
If you have a big family (5-8 members) who want run a family based pet kennel business, you can live in the big house (1 br, 1 bath, 2 offices, 1 living room, 1 dinning room，1 kitchen on second floor) and run kennel business in the first floor (which has 1 br 1 bath, 1 living room, plus 2 car garage) as office and customer reception area. The whole house plus farm land plus horse barn will rent for $800/month, plus $4500 security.
If you have a small family (2-3 members) who want run a family based pet kennel business, you can just rent the first floor (which has 1 br 1bath, 1 living room, 1 small kitchen, plus 2 car garage) as office and customer reception area. The walkout basement suite, plus farm land plus horse barn will lower to $800/month, plus $3000 security. In this lease contract, 1 car garage spot will be reserved for second floor tenants use.

Each of our Waukegan apartments features amenities like a patio/balcony, central heating and air, and more. When you become a resident of our community, you will have access to our pool and sundeck, a secure package receiving locker, and other great features that set us apart from others in the area. Fox Crest is a pet-friendly apartment community that is proud to welcome your furry friends! And talk about location! We are close to everything you need. Purchase your groceries nearby at Lewis Fresh Market. Restaurants nearby include Papa John's, Hoagie Hut, and more. Additionally, we are located near The Field House Sports and Fitness Center Walgreens, Starbucks, the People's Choice Family Fun Center, and more. Contact us today to make Fox Crest your new home!

Text2: Cozy 3 Bd/1 Ba Furnished Unit (Utilities Incl., FREE Wi-Fi & Laundry!)
Text3:
QR Code Link to This Post
            
        
I have a cozy 3 bedroom/1 bathroom unit with updated living spaces available to rent in the hip Bucktown/Logan Square area of town starting mid-December. The rent is $2,200 and includes...

- Fully furnished living room and dining room
- Renovated kitchen with all kitchen essentials, large and small kitchen appliances including a refrigerator, microwave, dishwasher, coffee maker, blender, toaster, etc. I can store all small electrics away if you have your own.
- Utilities Included! FREE high-speed Wi-Fi, water, as well as Netflix and select other services (HBO Max, Paramount+) (livestream gaming that uses large amounts of bandwidth is an upcharge)
- The two smaller bedrooms come with closets, nightstands, lamp, full-size platform beds with built in drawers for storage and remote-controlled ceiling fans. The master bedroom comes with a queen bed instead. The bedrooms will be perfect accommodation for up to 2 people in each room. 
- FREE LAUNDRY facilities in the unit in the basement with top-of-the-line large-capacity front-loading washer and dryer
- Newly installed backyard fence and deck

The Neighborhood:
There are LOTS of great restaurants, coffee shops, bars, stores, music venues, parks and other attractions in the neighborhood. Bustling and trendy Wicker Park and Bucktown is a 10-minute walk or just 1 stop on the Blue line. Walking distance to 2 grocery stores (Fresh Market and Aldi).

Getting Around:
There is free parking on the streets nearby or you can get parking stickers from the city to park on the street. Western, Armitage and Milwaukee buses are right by the house or the Western blue line stop is less than 5 minutes away. Five stops on the Blue line will take you to the loop for business or recreation in about 15 minutes. Besides the train, there are buses that can help take you anywhere you need. And of course, there are also taxis and Ubers galore.

I can send you a video tour first. If still interested, I can then arrange an in-person viewing. Please note that this unit is located in a 2-unit building, which means please be respectful of your noise levels since others live in the building.

Text2: Noblesville 2 Bed, 1 Bath Duplex
Text3:
QR Code Link to This Post
            
        
Seeking long term tenant(s) for a 2 Bedroom, 1 Bathroom Duplex home.  Initial two year lease required.

Building was constructed in 2006 and is in good condition.  Landlord provides lawn care.  The apartment is in an area where there will be road construction the next couple of years and will be adjacent to the new Pleasant Street Bypass and Midland Trace Trail.  Once the road and trail are completed, the apartment will be located at the end of a dead end street.  Being close to the trail, this would be an excellent home for someone who is active and enjoys the outdoors.

Apartment has electric baseboard heating and central air conditioning.  Rent is $1,100 per month.  An additional $65.00 per month is added that pays for water, sewer and trash and recycling service.  Tenant will connect and pay electric with Duke Energy and cable/internet of Tenant's choice.  Apartment includes stove, oven and microwave oven.  There is no dishwasher.

Washer/Dryer hookups are available.  A newer model washing machine and dryer can be rented from Landlord for an extra $35.00 per month.

Not accepting smokers or individuals who burn incense or excessive oil candles indoors due to the property damage that these activities cause.  We like to keep our places fresh and clean to better serve our tenant's health.  Soy candles and beeswax candles that do not emit soot are acceptable.

No pets permitted.

Tenants must provide proof of consistent monthly income to qualify with at least 3x the rent amount.

Deposit is $1,100.00
